title: Representing volume as the limit of a Riemann sum

content.prompt: A solid has a rectangular base that lies in the first quadrant and is bounded by the x- and y-axes and the lines x = 2 and y = 1. The height of the solid above the point (x, y) is 1 + 3x. Which of the following is a Riemann sum approximation for the volume of the solid?

choices.label: ∑ i = 1 n 1 n ( 1 + 3 i n ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@472D@

2 ∑ i = 1 n 1 n ( 1 + 3 i n ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47E9@

2 ∑ i = 1 n i n ( 1 + 3 i n ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47FD@

∑ i = 1 n 2 n ( 1 + 6 i n ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4712@

∑ i = 1 n 2 i n ( 1 + 6 i n ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4800@

topic.text: 6.3: Riemann Sums, Summation Notation, and Definite Integral Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
